g.title:
<
5. Qa4+
Blocking the attack with both the Bd7 (black
Queen cut off from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen drops back to
b3) and Qd7 (trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7block; white
continues with6. Nc3, black can not kick the
white Queen with a6 b5 because Bxb5 looses
the black rook. Black continues with6. .. g6
7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

>
g.text: Blocking the attack with both the Bd7 (black
Queen cut off from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen drops back to
b3) and Qd7 (trouble after Bb5) leads to
white Queen with a6 b5 because Bxb5 looses
the black rook. Black continues with

g.title:
<
8. Qb3 drop back
white Queen drops back as black king will
castle soon, pin is lost;8. .. 0-0 9. Bc4

opens up for Nc5 - Ne4 - Nd6 sequence --
nicely tucked away knight behind the IQP, or
alternatively Bf5 can be played if Qc2
instead of Qa3

>
g.text: white Queen drops back as black king will
opens up for Nc5 - Ne4 - Nd6 sequence --
nicely tucked away knight behind the IQP, or
alternatively Bf5 can be played if Qc2

<

unprotected after white Queen drops back to
b3) and Qd7 (trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7block; white

7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

white Queen drops back as black king will

>

<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5 Nf6

if Queen takes it can be harassed easily by
white for good development and IQP with good
look outs; advised move is Nf6

>
g.text: if Queen takes it can be harassed easily by
white for good development and IQP with good
look outs; advised move is Nf6

g.title:
<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5 Nf6

if Queen takes it can be harassed easily by
white for good development and IQP with good
look outs; advised move is Nf6

>-><
5. Qa4+
Blocking the attack with both the Bd7 (black
Queen cut off from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen drops back to
b3) and Qd7 (trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7block; white
continues with6. Nc3, black can not kick the
white Queen with a6 b5 because Bxb5 looses
the black rook. Black continues with6. .. g6
7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

>

<
5. Bb5+
Block with5. .. Nd7 6. Nc3 a6to kick the
bishop. If 7. Be2 that equalises for black
with several options to attack the d5 pawn
and kick the knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
white usually plays7. Qa4 Rb8 8. Bxd7 Bd7white
plays 8. Bxd7 to not to loose tempi.



after white Queen drops back to b3 or moves
over to f4 black can push b pawn to kick Nf3
knight and/or e7 and equalise or get better
if dxe7 Bxe7
>
g.text: bishop. If 7. Be2 that equalises for black
with several options to attack the d5 pawn
and kick the knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
plays 8. Bxd7 to not to loose tempi.
after white Queen drops back to b3 or moves
over to f4 black can push b pawn to kick Nf3
knight and/or e7 and equalise or get better

g.title:
<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5 Nf6

if Queen takes it can be harassed easily by
white for good development and IQP with good
look outs; advised move is Nf6

>-><
5. Bb5+
Block with5. .. Nd7 6. Nc3 a6to kick the
bishop. If 7. Be2 that equalises for black
with several options to attack the d5 pawn
and kick the knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
white usually plays7. Qa4 Rb8 8. Bxd7 Bd7white
plays 8. Bxd7 to not to loose tempi.



after white Queen drops back to b3 or moves
over to f4 black can push b pawn to kick Nf3
knight and/or e7 and equalise or get better
if dxe7 Bxe7
>

<
white's option 1 5. Nc3
mainLine
5. .. Nxd5 6. Nf3 Nxc3 7. bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7
9. Bd3 O-O 10. O-O Nc6 11. Re1; where Bg4 can
be played, exchanging the bishop for the
knight or e5 pawn sacrifice to uncover
weaknesses on the queens side with Qa5 later

>
g.text: 5. .. Nxd5 6. Nf3 Nxc3 7. bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7
be played, exchanging the bishop for the
knight or e5 pawn sacrifice to uncover
weaknesses on the queens side with Qa5 later

mainLine
5. .. Nxd5 6. Nf3 Nxc3 7. bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7
9. Bd3 O-O 10. O-O Nc6 11. Re1; where Bg4 can

<
The accelerated panov variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>

<
The accelerated panov variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>-><
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5 Nf6

if Queen takes it can be harassed easily by
white for good development and IQP with good
look outs; advised move is Nf6

>

<
regular panov and transposing into regular
from accelerated
regular panov is 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5
cxd5 4.c4; which can accelarated panov can
transpose into via 1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5 3. exd5
cxd5 4. d4

>
g.text: regular panov and transposing into regular
regular panov is 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5
cxd5 4.c4; which can accelarated panov can
transpose into via 1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5 3. exd5

g.title:
<
The accelerated panov variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>-><
regular panov and transposing into regular
from accelerated
regular panov is 1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5
cxd5 4.c4; which can accelarated panov can
transpose into via 1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5 3. exd5
cxd5 4. d4

>
